early.description: Born on a mining colony carved into an asteroid, your earliest memories are of tunnels and machinery.
At age seven, you helped repair a broken drill, showcasing your mechanical aptitude.
You began working alongside your family in the mines, building physical strength and endurance.
A cave-in trapped you for hours, teaching you resilience and the importance of safety protocols.
You developed a knack for finding rich veins of ore, impressing the seasoned miners.
An encounter with corporate overseers revealed the harsh realities of corporate control.
You customized your mining tools for better efficiency, showcasing your ingenuity.
An older miner taught you advanced techniques, enhancing your productivity.
You formed a close bond with a fellow miner's child, sharing dreams of life beyond the asteroid.
A malfunction in the life-support system required quick action to prevent disaster.
You began to question the fairness of the corporation's policies, noticing disparities.
An accident left you with a scar, a constant reminder of the mine's dangers.
You discovered an unusual mineral, sparking interest from corporate scientists.
A family member fell ill due to hazardous working conditions, fueling your resentment.
You started studying engineering texts salvaged from shipments, expanding your knowledge.
An equipment upgrade increased output but also accidents, raising concerns.
You participated in a clandestine meeting discussing worker rights.

mid.description: You took on significant responsibilities, managing labor tasks essential to operations.
A conflict with corporate enforcers led to increased tension and surveillance.
You orchestrated a successful effort to improve living conditions for your fellow workers.
An offer to relocate your family to a better station challenged your sense of solidarity.
You began mentoring younger miners, passing on your skills and safety practices.
A personal injury forced you to adapt, relying more on wisdom than brute strength.
You discovered evidence of corporate negligence causing hazardous conditions.
A family member was unjustly punished, fueling your desire for justice.
You faced ethical dilemmas when asked to inform on fellow workers.
An accident led to the loss of essential supplies, testing your resourcefulness.

late.description: Promoted to a leadership role, you now oversee significant mining operations.
A major disaster required you to coordinate rescue efforts under extreme pressure.
You discovered a massive deposit that could change the colony's fortunes.
Faced with corporate demands for increased output, you had to balance productivity with safety.
An opportunity to leave the asteroid and pursue education elsewhere challenged your commitments.
You exposed a corrupt official exploiting workers, leading to significant changes.
A personal loss prompted you to reconsider your life's direction.
You began to suffer from health issues due to prolonged exposure to hazardous materials.
An uprising among the workers placed you in a position to lead or suppress the movement.
You mentored a young miner who looked up to you, influencing the next generation.
A corporate takeover threatened the livelihoods of everyone on the asteroid.
You authored a proposal for safer mining practices, challenging corporate norms.
An external threat, such as pirates or rival corporations, endangered the colony.
You faced a moral dilemma when ordered to exploit a hazardous area for profit.
An opportunity to retire arose, but leaving the only life you've known proved difficult.
You considered joining a movement to break free from corporate control.
A technological advancement threatened to replace manual labor, challenging your relevance.
